sentences: Patrícia Nogueira Ribeiro (born 11 October 1981), better known as Patrícia Ribeiro is a Portuguese transsexual singer, songwriter, model and dancer.

sentences: == 1981–2011: Early years ==

sentences: Patrícia was born Nuno Nogueira Ribeiro, in Cova da Piedade, Almada, 11 October 1981.
section: == 1981–2011: Early years ==

sentences: He began his musical career at age eleven.
section: == 1981–2011: Early years ==

sentences: He came to be known as Nuno, in youth group Onda Choc, joined in several children's and youth groups Jovens Cantores de Lisboa, directed by Ana Faria.
section: == 1981–2011: Early years ==

sentences: In the 2000s, after the youth groups he participated in, he attempted a solo career over the course of two years, even releasing a CD "O Sonho Nasce" at age 19 as Ricky, a popular singer who didn't avenge.
section: == 1981–2011: Early years ==

sentences: In 2001, to promote his debut album "O Sonho Nasce" and the first single "Sabor do Teu Beijo" participated in several programs such as: Made In Portugal by RTP.
section: == 1981–2011: Early years ==

sentences: In 2004, she starred in a documentary aired on Sociedade Independente de Comunicação "Grande Reportagem" about the difficulties of transsexuals with their families, a theme that was then taboo, and impacting viewers of "Jornal da Noite".
section: == 1981–2011: Early years ==

sentences: On 4 November 2008, Ribeiro underwent a sex change operation at Hospital Santa Maria in Lisbon.
section: == 1981–2011: Early years ==

sentences: In 2011 she decided to pursue a solo career and released her first work titled É Real, an album with eleven tracks, emphasizing dance music and Latin rhythms.

== Since 2016: Chama Por Mim, controversy and imprisonment ==

sentences: Since 2016: Chama Por Mim, controversy and imprisonment ==
section: == Since 2016: Chama Por Mim, controversy and imprisonment ==

sentences: In 2016, she started recording her fourth studio álbum "Chama Por Mim", produced by José Felix, announced a bonus track with Brazilian singer Gretchen and had the first single "Boys (Meu Principe Encantado)" with the music video recorded at Arpoador and Ipanema beaches, both located in the city of Rio de Janeiro, RJ – Brazil.
section: == Since 2016: Chama Por Mim, controversy and imprisonment ==

sentences: The release of the track had great repercussion in Brazil, his first performances in some television programs "Mulheres", "Superpop", "A Tarde é Sua", "A Tarde é Show" and "Em Revista".

sentences: The second single "O Amor e o Poder (Como uma Deusa)" was announced in May, with its passage in Brazil and after several comparisons in television programs in which they claimed "is the Portuguese Rosanah", in commemoration launched the music video on 6 July 2016, the same was recorded in São Paulo and had as model her husband Fábio Andrade.
section: == Since 2016: Chama Por Mim, controversy and imprisonment ==

sentences: At the end of 2016 Patrícia Ribeiro was arrested and is in the Tires jail accused of having extorted about 400 thousand euros from a businessman who threatened to divulge photos of BDSM practices (bondage, domination, sadism and masochism).
section: == Since 2016: Chama Por Mim, controversy and imprisonment ==

sentences: The artist and her boyfriend, both accused of qualified extortion, were arrested on 9 December 2016 after an investigation by the Lisbon Public Prosecutor's Office.
section: == Since 2016: Chama Por Mim, controversy and imprisonment ==

sentences: She was eventually condemned to 7 years in prison.
section: == Since 2016: Chama Por Mim, controversy and imprisonment ==
